lead_paragraph: As protests have dwindled over the official investigation into the disappearance of 43 students, many fear the ruling party will face few political consequences.

byline.contributor: Paulina Villegas and Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Few Expect Mexico’s Government to Suffer at Polls, Despite Outrage Over Abductions
headline.main: Few Expect Mexico’s Government to Suffer at Polls, Despite Outrage Over Abductions

snippet: As protests have dwindled over the official investigation into the disappearance of 43 students, many fear the ruling party will face few political consequences.
abstract: Sympathizers and family of 43 students who disappeared after being seized by police in Iguala, Mexico, in 2014 fear government of Pres Enrique Pena Nieto will suffer little damage in election for its botched investigation of incident and apparent cover-up; protest movement has flagged, while government has managed to stonewall international panel's inquiry.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
